label: 童子, 童真
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Term usually refers to those under 20 who vow to leave the home life, study under a master but due to their youth have as yet to receive the precepts. The term is also sometimes used to refer to a bodhisattva. In Japan, the term usually referred to youths resident in temples who performed a variety of tasks on behalf the monks. Sometimes objects of erotic interest by the monks, dōji seem in practice to have been of all ages. The term also sometimes refers to youth who wore elaborate garb, performing dances and other activities in temple and court ceremonies.
